body.name: Spinbrush Pro Whiten, Battery Toothbrush for Adults, Medium Bristles, Batteries Included
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Monday, February 19 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35
Or fastest delivery Friday, February 16. Order within 4 hrs 37 mins
features: WHITEN TEETH IN ONE WEEK with Spinbrush PRO WHITEN battery powered toothbrush, designed with a rotating whitening cup and whitening bristles
DUAL ACTION BRUSH HEAD features oscillating circle (spinner) and sliding plate (scrubber), moving up to 3,900 sweeps per minute
SOFT SWITCH power buttons are easier to turn on/off and help prevent water from leaking inside the brush
COLOR WEAR BRISTLES fade with use and help remind you to replace your brush head every 3 months
Formerly known as ARM & HAMMER Spinbrush ProWhite
body.description: Be selfie-ready with your NEW and improved Spinbrush PRO WHITEN Powered Toothbrush! The dual-action brush head is made with whitening bristles and is clinically proven to deliver whiter teeth in one week! The replaceable electric toothbrush heads feature Color-Wear bristles that fade over time to help remind you when it's time to replace with a new toothbrush head. Keep your handle to save money and plastic with Spinbrush brand toothbrush bristles refill packs! Handles are available in premium silver or rose gold accent colors and may vary with purchase. Toothbrush includes two (2) replaceable AA Duracell batteries. Spinbrush battery-powered toothbrushes are Dentist Recommended, Not Tested on Animals, and Made Without BPA Plastics. The new, easy-to-open carton is recyclable and the tray inside (plastic #1) is made with recycled materials. A battery toothbrush is a great way to compliment your routine teeth whitening at home. Spin your way to a bright white smile!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great Spin Brush
reviews.reviewText: Very affordable and does the job. I noticed a difference in how clean my teeth look and feel. Would recommend.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2016
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent cleaning, affordability, & battery options
reviews.reviewText: They clean our teeth exceptionally well and quickly; can use rechargeable, alkaline or standard AA batteries; and best of all have similar cost to old less effective manual toothbrushes in the long term. We're using Costco's Eneloop batteries that take only a couple of hours to charge, but alkalines you can buy most anywhere last a long time too (haven't tried regular non-alkalines but they're probably fine too). My spouse was bothered by the Spinbrush's noise level with alkalines, but I found that the lower voltage of fully charged Eneloop batteries (1.2v vs. 1.5v) makes it run more slowly and quietly while still doing a great job of cleaning our teeth. It goes a couple of weeks on one charge. I find it helps to wet the brush before applying paste, because water lubricates the mechanism so it runs faster and uses less battery overcoming the initial friction before liquid gets into the brush on its own.We'd been using the vastly more expensive Braun Oral B Professional Care 2000 but when the battery life started to shorten after a couple of years of interminable 18 hour recharging cycle, we finally tried the Spinbrush Pro my sister had given us. It does a better job than the Oral B, on top of all the other advantages, plus being smaller and lighter for travel. We found some unsettling Spinbrush info online, including a recall from people actually being injured by early versions of these, but they've made some changes and now they're fine with reasonable care (e.g. don't use as a hammer, so maybe not robust enough for some kids).Unlike some reviewers, we've found the batteries easy to install/replace. It's literally a snap. I've attached a pic showing that you put thumbs together where the cap meets the Spinbrush, and your fingers further away from that point on the other side. Pushing firmly up with your thumbs while pushing down with your fingers, you hear a little snap and it's partly open as in the pic. Then you can wiggle the cap out the rest of the way or push with just one thumb on the opposite side to make it even easier (that moves the catch on the outside of the hidden battery cap away from the Spinbrush body for easier opening). My spouse likes to just continue the move used to get the snap while pulling out and wobbling the cap, but sometimes that spills batteries on the floor when it opens. The battery caps seem to come in either dark gray or white, so if you have the gray you might not notice the little diagram you can see more clearly on the pic of my white cap than on my spouse's gray cap. On the cap are the battery polarity indicators too.We like the Spinbrush so much my spouse bought another one and we've retired the Brauns. Highly Recommend.

reviews.reviewText: Really cleans your teeth but is pretty loud. Got used to it after a few days.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Arm & Hammer Spinbrush
reviews.reviewText: Arm & Hammer Spinbrush replaced older version which I had for 7 years. Batteries were already in - but no protection to prevent battery from draining. Came with toothbrush head already attached. Brush did not have power of my previous one and Batteries died on 3rd day. I replaced Batteries and it's now a stronger motion to clean teeth. It is extremely noisy and vibrates. Idk if it's their upgrades or if it was a damaged brush. Will find a better brush and save this for emergencies.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 26, 2023
reviews.reviewText: It works great but it’s sooooo loud. I use my Sonic brush more because of the noise this one makes. If you trying not to wake the house up then do not buy this brush because you’re going to wake someone up lol

I have these toothbrushes set to auto subscription because it is then easy to remember to replace them. I love these toothbrushes, they are durable and work so well. I find they leave your mouth feeling so clean. Amazon has them for a great price, and you never have to remember to pick them up while at a store.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on December 14, 2022
reviews.reviewText: I used to buy these from B&M however they haven’t had them for a couple of years. I have bought many in that period every one no way comes up to the standard of these spin brushes. My dentist says he wishes all of his patients teeth were like mine perfect
